meanings.definition: The condition of being mute or unable to speak.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, he developed mutisms and could no longer talk.
meanings.sent2: The classroom was filled with mutisms as the students concentrated on their test.
meanings.sent3: The mutisms of the shy girl made her the perfect listener in the group.
meanings.sent4: The mutisms of the old house echoed with memories of laughter and joy.
meanings.sent5: The mutisms of the forest at night were broken only by the hoot of an owl.

meanings.definition: The absence of speech or vocal communication.
meanings.sent1: The mutisms of the library were disrupted by the loud ringing of a phone.
meanings.sent2: The mutisms in the room made it clear that something was wrong.
meanings.sent3: The mutisms of the party were broken by a sudden burst of laughter.
meanings.sent4: The mutisms of the desert at noon were overwhelming in their intensity.
meanings.sent5: The mutisms of the empty stadium emphasized the loneliness of the moment.
